data.title: .NET Microservices with Azure Service Fabric: A real-world perspective
data.sortTitle: .net microservices with azure service fabric: a real-world perspective
data.description: Find out how you can use Azure Service Fabric to simplify the task of building .NET based microservices applications. In this customer-led session, we walk through the benefits of Service Fabric and showcase real-world examples, including a Windows-based ISV, running their mission-critical services at scale. If you want to learn about how you can leverage the proven technology that powers Microsoft services including Azure SQL Database, Azure Cosmos DB, Skype, Microsoft Dynamics, Xbox Live, and large-scale deployments for enterprise customers, then this session is for you.

data.title: .NET platform overview and roadmap
data.sortTitle: .net platform overview and roadmap
data.description: Join Scott Hunter and Scott Hanselman as they talk about the present and future of .NET. Come see the latest updates in .NET Core 3.1 and how you can be more productive building intelligent applications that run on any platform. Learn about the latest Windows desktop support, features for building better web apps and microservices, and much more. Also, see what the future has in store with .NET 5.

data.title: 99+% of breaches didn’t occur because technology failed us. It’s time to fix the people problem!
data.sortTitle: 99+% of breaches didn’t occur because technology failed us. it’s time to fix the people problem!
data.description:
99+% of breaches and compliance failures didn’t occur because technology failed us. People are almost always to blame! A vast majority of your users click on phishing links and install malicious apps while browsing online. Your compliance teams struggle to keep up with the latest changes to regulation, and your defenders vary widely in terms of skills and often lose what effectively is a race against time. 

The answer to this challenge is to couple your security and compliance solutions with fully integrated attack simulation and user training capabilities so you can:

•	Identify exploitable employees and weaknesses in your defenses
•	Reduce employee related risks and improve the effectiveness of your defenders
•	Raise your security posture and meet regulatory and compliance obligations

Come join us to learn about the integrated attack simulation and user training capabilities that we are adding to Microsoft 365.

data.title: A 360 degree view of Veeam solutions in a multi-cloud world
data.sortTitle: a 360 degree view of veeam solutions in a multi-cloud world
data.description:
This session covers four key scenarios including: on-premises and hybrid datacenters,  cloud storage for long-term retention and regulatory compliance, migration/disaster recovery using “the cloud”, and protecting Office 365. This session includes lots of demos and not many slides, presented by two Veeamers with 40+ years of combined expertise in Microsoft-fueled IT. 

See how Veeam is moving beyond backup for hybrid-environments built on Hyper-V, VMware, and IaaS. Learn how to use Azure as a repository for backups and as a secondary site for disaster recovery. Discover what Microsoft Office 365 does to natively protect its data and how that can be supplemented with Veeam. Finally, hear what Veeam is delivering next.

data.title: A customer panel: Navigating the deployment of Microsoft hyperconverged infrastructure (HCI) to conquer IT
data.sortTitle: a customer panel: navigating the deployment of microsoft hyperconverged infrastructure (hci) to conquer it
data.description: How do innovations in software defined infrastructure on Microsoft Azure Stack HCI help solve IT challenges? Aging infrastructure? Migration woes? Limited budget? Hear from a diverse, interactive, and low-yawn-factor panel of real-world customers and partners who deployed Microsoft hyperconverged infrastructure to conquer modern IT problems with Lenovo ThinkAgile MX.

data.title: A deep dive into managing Microsoft Teams
data.sortTitle: a deep dive into managing microsoft teams
data.description: Microsoft Teams is designed with IT in mind, providing management capabilities for collaboration, meetings, callings, and apps. Explore the full range of management features available for configuring, managing, and monitoring Microsoft Teams. We walk through the full scope of controls - from enabling a smoother onboarding experience to ongoing maintenance and optimization of your environment.

data.title: A deep-dive into conversational AI using Azure Bot Service and Cognitive Services
data.sortTitle: a deep-dive into conversational ai using azure bot service and cognitive services
data.description: Enterprises have a significant need to deliver a conversational assistant tailored to their brand, personalized to their users, and made available across a broad range of devices and social canvases. In this session we deep dive into building conversational AI solutions leveraging the latest tools from the Azure Bot Service and Cognitive Services. We also showcase how to build an end-to-end solution using the open-source Virtual Assistant that provides developers and enterprises a set of core foundational capabilities and full control over the end-user experience.

data.title: A developer's guide to Azure Cosmos DB, from onboarding to going live in production
data.sortTitle: a developer's guide to azure cosmos db, from onboarding to going live in production
data.description: It's never been a better time to be a developer on Azure Cosmos DB. In this practical, demo-heavy session, we go through the developer journey end to end, all the way from loading data into Azure Cosmos DB to going live in production. At each step, we show the tools, features, and best practices, including how to use our new SDKs, choose the right amount of throughput and partition key, do benchmark/performance testing, debug and diagnose issues, setup tests in CI/CD, and operationalize/monitor in production.

data.title: A first look at policy-based security for Azure SQL Database
data.sortTitle: a first look at policy-based security for azure sql database
data.description:
A critical adoption blocker for enterprises moving to the cloud is the lack of a central control mechanism for protecting sensitive data in a consistent, secure, and compliant manner. Our research has shown that the confidence level of enterprise customers in the cloud would increase dramatically if they had (1) customer controlled encryption, (2) attribute based access control, (3) tamper evident logs (ledgers), and (4) the ability to configure and enforce these controls via a central policy system across multiple data engines. 

This session provides an overview of how we are combining the power of Azure Information Protection for Bring Your Own Key and Access Control policies with strong security assurances of Always Encrypted (AE) in Azure SQL Database, together for the first two data engines: Azure SQL Database Managed Instance and Azure Stream Analytics. We demonstrate how it can be used to secure sensitive data on premises, during migration, and while in use in Azure SQL Database Managed Instance.

data.title: A look ahead to the future of Windows 10 Pro and modern devices
data.sortTitle: a look ahead to the future of windows 10 pro and modern devices
data.description: Join us to learn what lies ahead for Windows 10 Pro and discover the innovative directions our OEM partners are taking with modern devices. This session offers a view into the features and updates being planned for upcoming Windows 10 Pro releases. We also showcase some of our OEM partners’ new modern devices that are firing up your organizations’ productivity, protecting its user identities and data, and providing you with hardware and software solutions to help you more effectively manage your infrastructure.

data.title: A look at the future of developer productivity and collaboration
data.sortTitle: a look at the future of developer productivity and collaboration
data.description: As applications are growing in complexity and development teams become increasingly distributed, accelerating velocity while maintaining quality has never been more difficult. In this session, get an early look at new developer services that empower modern teams with setup-free development environments, efficient collaboration for both real-time, and async workflows and AI-assisted productivity, all powered by the cloud.

data.title: A real-world look at Windows Virtual Desktop, the best virtualization experience, delivered on Azure
data.sortTitle: a real-world look at windows virtual desktop, the best virtualization experience, delivered on azure
data.description: Come learn about our new desktop virtualization service, Windows Virtual Desktop, including guidance on how to set up your environment on Azure. We also dive into considerations for global deployments, latency and end user experience, and general best practices.

data.title: Accelerate SAP S/4HANA deployment with Microsoft Azure
data.sortTitle: accelerate sap s/4hana deployment with microsoft azure
data.description:
As SAP customers consider their move to SAP S/4HANA, our next-generation ERP, they have a complete choice of deployment. SAP customers have found that Microsoft Azure is an ideal way to run with all the benefits of the cloud, yet preserve their substantial investments in the configuration and customization of their on-premises SAP deployment. In this session:
•	Consider what makes SAP S/4HANA different from previous ERP
•	Understand the strategic choices in SAP S/4HANA deployment
•	Learn how the benefits of running SAP S/4HANA on Microsoft Azure and see customer examples

data.title: Accelerate your digital transformation journey with Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
data.sortTitle: accelerate your digital transformation journey with microsoft cloud adoption framework for azure
data.description: Learn how you can take advantage of the cloud platform to deliver on business goals. Hear from Microsoft customers and partners how they are embracing the cloud and transforming organizations to maximize growth and business results.

data.title: Accelerate your RDS and VDI migration to Windows Virtual Desktop
data.sortTitle: accelerate your rds and vdi migration to windows virtual desktop
data.description: Come learn how to migrate existing Remote Desktop Services (RDS) and Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) environments to Windows Virtual Desktop. We cover best practices, user profile and image migrations, migration tools, and much more.

data.title: Accelerate your success with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
data.sortTitle: accelerate your success with microsoft dynamics 365 customer insights
data.description: Learn how Dynamics 365 Customer Insights can help you land new deals and further your Dynamics 365 practice. Join this session to learn about the revenue opportunity and how to leverage our growth momentum and competitive advantage to seize this opportunity. Get specific guidance on positioning, targeting, and execution tactics. Understand the resources, and best practices on how to effectively sell Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.

data.title: Accelerating DevOps scenarios with Microsoft Teams
data.sortTitle: accelerating devops scenarios with microsoft teams
data.description: Use Microsoft Teams to improve your development and IT service operations. See our integrations with other popular apps and do it all on your mobile device!

data.title: Accelerating your IT career
data.sortTitle: accelerating your it career
data.description: Your career isn’t win or lose anymore, it is win or die. The days of guaranteed work, pensions, and sticking with one company for fifty years are gone. Success has returned to something Cro-Magnon would recognize: if you’re good at what you do, you get to eat. Hack your career by learning and embracing the concepts from four simple pillars: discipline, technical powerhouse, communication, and legacy. In this session, learn how to identify strategies that will enable you to have a successful career in IT and reach your next level.

data.title: Accelerating your journey from automated to autonomous systems: The Microsoft autonomous systems platform
data.sortTitle: accelerating your journey from automated to autonomous systems: the microsoft autonomous systems platform
data.description:
From smart sensors and actuating devices to integrated robotic systems, industrial organizations are employing increasingly sophisticated automation technologies to drive efficiency and productivity. As a result, a new class of systems are evolving to go beyond basic automation. Instead of performing specific tasks repeatedly without variation, these autonomous systems sense and dynamically respond to changing environments to accomplish a desired goal. Autonomous systems are capable of not only routine, process-driven tasks, but also deliver increasingly optimized results while freeing up human capital to operate at a higher strategic level.
 
To get the most value from autonomous systems, businesses will need to take an integrated, cross-functional approach. This means leveraging existing expertise by engaging their domain experts to help build and manage these systems, not just data scientists and software developers. And, it means creating secure and compliant systems that are also transparent, explainable, and open so that they can work effectively with a broader ecosystem. All of this requires a platform designed for integration, evolution, and scale.
 
Microsoft offers a trusted, enterprise-grade platform for creating autonomous systems that build on unique organizational domain expertise. Our comprehensive portfolio of tools and services enables organizations and their employees to develop, manage, and optimize autonomous systems across the full lifecycle. Our vision is to empower humans to achieve more by accelerating the journey from automated to autonomous systems.
 
In this session, learn about this platform and the techniques that enable building this new class of powerful solutions.

data.title: Accelerating your onboarding to Microsoft Teams
data.sortTitle: accelerating your onboarding to microsoft teams
data.description: Join us in this fast-paced session to see in action the latest management capabilities to help you onboard to Microsoft Teams. Whether you are looking to prepare your network or plan your overall deployment, we have the tools and resources you need.

data.title: Achieving petabyte-scale data ingestion with Azure Data Factory
data.sortTitle: achieving petabyte-scale data ingestion with azure data factory
data.description: In this session, we talk about the common data ingest challenges, patterns, and best practices based on our learnings from working directly with customers and partners. We walk through real-world customer cases and showcase solutions for loading petabyte-scale data into Azure using Azure Data Factory. We also share roadmap for data ingestion.

data.title: Adopting the Microsoft Power Platform in the enterprise
data.sortTitle: adopting the microsoft power platform in the enterprise
data.description: More and more large organizations with complex missions are connecting siloed data, engaging customers, and driving ROI with amazing custom solutions on Power Platform — Microsoft PowerApps, Power BI, Microsoft Flow and the Common Data Service (CDS). Mature organizations realize that rigor, discipline, and best practices are needed to truly adopt such a nimble, yet versatile, platform at scale. This session introduces the Power Platform Adoption Framework and gives an overview of its start-to-finish approach to help you and your organization get the most value out of any form of Power Platform available to you today. We also share how other enterprise organizations have scaled with large and complex needs using Power Platform and what were the tools, best practices and patterns they explored and used to become successful adopters.

data.title: Advanced monitoring: Five Azure Monitor best practices you should know
data.sortTitle: advanced monitoring: five azure monitor best practices you should know
data.description: In this session we look at some of the best practices we have learned from years of running customer workloads and also our own workloads on Azure. If you already use Azure Monitor, you will find this session beneficial as it shows you some of nuances, design considerations, tools, and practices you need to scale your monitoring to the next level.

data.title: Advanced networking best practices with Azure ExpressRoute
data.sortTitle: advanced networking best practices with azure expressroute
data.description: Azure ExpressRoute offers enterprise-grade connectivity to Microsoft cloud services enabling scenarios requiring private connectivity for predictable bandwidth and latency.  This session provides an update on new ExpressRoute capabilities and covers detailed architectural design considerations and best practices based on our vast experience helping enterprises run mission-critical workloads in Azure.

data.title: AI behind call center analytics: Using Azure Cognitive Services to improve customer experiences
data.sortTitle: ai behind call center analytics: using azure cognitive services to improve customer experiences
data.description: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales Insights application is now generally available (GA), and Azure customers are using Azure Cognitive Services to draw deeper insights from call center interactions with customers. In this talk we deep dive into how Speech Services, Text Analytics, and Anomaly Detector can be used together to extract information from the content of customer conversations, track call center and agent performance, identify issues in real time, and improve the quality of customer interactions overall. We show how the same extraction pipeline can be used to monitor voice of customer (VOC) across other content streams, as well, including social media, blogs, and customer surveys.

data.title: AI behind call center transcription: Using Azure Cognitive Services to improve customer experience
data.sortTitle: ai behind call center transcription: using azure cognitive services to improve customer experience
data.description: Enterprises transcribing telephony data in call centers face challenges when converting speech-to-text for telephony data generated through landlines, mobile phones, and radios that are typically low quality, and narrowband in the range of 8 KHz. The latest speech recognition models from Azure Cognitive Services excel at transcribing this telephony data, even in cases when the data is difficult for a human to understand. Telephony data can be used to better understand your customers' needs, identify new marketing opportunities, or evaluate the performance of call center agents. After the data is transcribed, a business can use the output for improved telemetry, identifying key phrases, or analyzing customer sentiment.

data.title: AI innovation: Revitalizing the live presentation experience
data.sortTitle: ai innovation: revitalizing the live presentation experience
data.description: Live presentations can be nerve-wracking yet energizing. Over the last year we have invested heavily in revitalizing the live presentation experience and want to showcase our innovations in Microsoft Office. From ideating in Whiteboard to creating slides with ease through AI in Designer with 3D and Inking, to practicing your sessions with AI with Presenter Coach, to stepping on stage to give a talk with Live Presentations & Subtitles and an exciting new feature we will announce at Ignite, we want to make your presentations come alive. We are joined by a customer to talk more about this. Come and learn more!

data.title: AI powered web search with Bing Search APIs, and more
data.sortTitle: ai powered web search with bing search apis, and more
data.description: In today’s competitive landscape, a business’s success is predicated on its ability to provide its users with the right products and services. In this session, learn how easy it is to create a tailored, end-to-end solution using Bing APIs such as Bing Custom Search, Bing Web Search, Bing Visual Search, Bing Entity Search, Bing Autosuggest, Bing Spell Check, and more. Next, learn how to triangulate multiple data sources to develop more nuanced insights and an improved understanding of customer sentiments using a combination of Cognitive AI API capabilities. Discover how companies around the world are using these APIs to access the powerful Bing knowledge graph and index for scenarios like plagiarism detection, fraud detection, infusing applications with contextual intelligence and reinforcing their existing datasets, and many more. Leverage these APIs to grow your business.

data.title: AI within reach: Zero code solutions at enterprise scale with Azure Machine Learning [designer]
data.sortTitle: ai within reach: zero code solutions at enterprise scale with azure machine learning [designer]
data.description: Artificial Intelligence is right here, right now—and we’re making machine learning possible for all skill levels. The visual designer capability in Azure Machine Learning service is a powerful but simple drag and drop authoring environment with no code needed. You can go from ideation to deployment in a matter of clicks, build high accuracy machine learning models, and create workflows easily. Whether you are new to machine learning, a data scientist or a developer, you can leverage this platform to accelerate your data science journey. See in action how our enterprise customers empowered their data science teams to solve business challenges with real-time AI.

data.title: AI-powered analytics in Microsoft Excel: Deep dive into the latest AI-powered capabilities and more to gain deep insights from your data
data.sortTitle: ai-powered analytics in microsoft excel: deep dive into the latest ai-powered capabilities and more to gain deep insights from your data
data.description: Join this session to learn how to explore and analyze your data with the power of new capabilities within Microsoft Excel, including the ability to ask questions and get answers using Natural Language, new additions to the "Excel Ideas" feature powered by ML based techniques, and cloud-connected geography and stocks data types. Unlock new scenarios and simplify your spreadsheets with the latest lookup functions, and enhance data classification and protection in your enterprise environment.

data.title: Analyze, manage, and optimize your cloud cost with Azure Cost Management
data.sortTitle: analyze, manage, and optimize your cloud cost with azure cost management
data.description: In this session, we cover the feature available in Azure Cost Management for better cost governance and billing management. Understand how to get better visibility into your cloud cost for Azure and AWS using Cost Analysis, Microsoft Power BI, Exports and APIs. Monitor and control your costs using budgets, forecasts, and alerts. Learn how to have better accountability using chargeback and cost allocation capabilities in cost management. Get more savings by using native optimization and recommendations on your Azure services and purchases.

data.title: Android device management with Microsoft Intune
data.sortTitle: android device management with microsoft intune
data.description: The Microsoft Intune Android management solution offers new Android Enterprise (AE) device management choices. See tours and demos on expanded options, including OEMConfig and increased support for MGP, and learn how to modernize the end user experiences and take advantage of superior IT admin tools.

data.title: Announcing Bing Maps Geospatial Analytics Platform Preview for Enterprise Business Planning
data.sortTitle: announcing bing maps geospatial analytics platform preview for enterprise business planning
data.description: Need help in determining where to expand, build or deploy resources to meet customer demand? Don’t know how your business KPI vary from location to location? The new Bing Maps Geospatial Analytics solution takes the difficulty out of wrangling location intelligence data and helps you arrive at location-based business decisions faster. In this session, you’ll learn how to use a local business, parcel info, demographics, etc. to identify underserved locations for future business expansion or uncover key locations insights for your business.

data.title: API management for microservices in a hybrid and multi-cloud world
data.sortTitle: api management for microservices in a hybrid and multi-cloud world
data.description:
Microservices are on the cusp of becoming the dominant style of software architecture in the enterprise. The benefits that are realized—increased developer velocity, improved organizational agility, and reduced time-to-market of new services—are a powerful catalyst that is driving this transformation. As practitioners, how do we successfully fit microservices into the models and processes we already have in place?

Join Tom Kerkhove, an Azure architect with many years of experience helping enterprises make this exact transition, for a hands-on experience as he walks through demo after demo on how he helps enterprises make the transition to API-first architectures and microservices in a hybrid, multi-cloud world.

data.title: APIs and the open banking revolution
data.sortTitle: apis and the open banking revolution
data.description: At its most basic, 'open banking' is the use of APIs to connect banks to the outside world. Open banking, as a concept, has caught fire in Europe and is starting to make waves in the United States. It is more important than ever that financial institutions start adopting these open practices—or they risk being left behind. In this session, we discuss what open banking is, why it matters, and how Azure API Management helps financial institutions create new lines of business and uncover new opportunities by embracing connected ecosystems, through the lens of real-world customer examples.

data.title: App development for everyone with Hanselman and friends
data.sortTitle: app development for everyone with hanselman and friends
data.description: In this session Scott Hanselman and friends welcome every developer to a fun demo-packed session where we explore how you can grow your skills and build any kind of application with your favorite tools and languages, collaborate with the largest developer community on the planet, and release your apps in an open and innovative end-to-end cloud platform.

data.title: Applying best practices to Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
data.sortTitle: applying best practices to azure kubernetes service (aks)
data.description: This is the perfect session if you want to boost your confidence in operationalizing best practices on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). We dive into the tools, features, and best practices we learned from deep customer engagement.

data.title: Architecting an elegant data management strategy with Rubrik
data.sortTitle: architecting an elegant data management strategy with rubrik
data.description:
Whether HR has deleted an important file or you’re the victim of a massive ransomware attack, a backup administrator is always called upon to save the day. Without a properly designed and robust backup solution this becomes a challenge. A backup strategy must be flexible enough to account for change, while providing a reliable and consistent safeguard for organizations. 

Let Rubrik bring your backup and recovery strategy to life! You'll leave with an understanding of how to architect a robust data management strategy utilizing Rubrik, including mapping RPOs and RTOs to declarative protection policies and leveraging public cloud for more than a simple archive target for long-term retention.

data.title: Architecting and implementing governance across your Azure subscriptions
data.sortTitle: architecting and implementing governance across your azure subscriptions
data.description: In this session, we go over cloud governance best practices, and how Azure makes it easier to apply them across all your subscriptions, so you can achieve your business goals. We  cover benefits of using services such as Azure Policy, Management Groups, Blueprints, and Resource Graph to provide the right guardrails for your environment.

data.title: Architecting SAP landscapes with demanding performance requirements on Azure
data.sortTitle: architecting sap landscapes with demanding performance requirements on azure
data.description: Come learn how to best architect your SAP environment for performance optimization and security. We will dive into architectural blueprints based on proven customer deployments to deliver 99.99% availability, low RTO/RPO, business continuity and high performance. Specifically, we will showcase how Azure storage offers such as Azure NetApp Files and Azure Ultra Disks will change the way you deal with extreme low latency SAP databases on Azure.

data.title: Architecting your intelligent intranet with SharePoint hubs, branding, and site designs
data.sortTitle: architecting your intelligent intranet with sharepoint hubs, branding, and site designs
data.description: Join the Microsoft SharePoint product group to learn best practices for architecting and deploying an intelligent intranet with SharePoint. Learn how hubs enable you to organize your intranet, and how site designs let you deploy sites with consistent structure and functionality. We also explore options for creating "roll up" experiences, portals, and landing pages for your organization with new SharePoint home sites. You'll leave knowing your options for implementing an information architecture that connects the digital estate.

data.title: Artificial intelligence in an age of social responsibility
data.sortTitle: artificial intelligence in an age of social responsibility
data.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) is providing a once-in-a-generation opportunity for us to deliver new, transformational value to individuals and organizations alike and while AI has the potential to solve humanitarian issues, create a safer more sustainable world, and accessible workplace, this opportunity must be guided by a strong ethical framework. For AI to reach its potential in serving humans, every engineer will need to learn more about the liberal arts and every liberal arts major will need to learn more about engineering. Join Jeffrey Snover and Bill Baer as they explain Microsoft's approach to addressing these issues and explore how social sciences and humanities are sacrosanct to the development of AI as computers are beginning to behave more like humans.

data.title: Automate and manage your Windows Server environment using Azure Management Services
data.sortTitle: automate and manage your windows server environment using azure management services
data.description: Azure Management Services help you reduce your TCO and empower your application teams to manage their servers while keeping the control and guidance in the hands of central IT. Come learn how you can use Azure Governance to configure and monitor all your VMs at scale and how Microsoft IT uses Azure Management Services to manage their large cloud footprint.

data.title: Automate your business with Nintex, Microsoft Teams, and Microsoft Dynamics 365
data.sortTitle: automate your business with nintex, microsoft teams, and microsoft dynamics 365
data.description: Nintex platform helps thousands of organizations automate their simple to sophisticated business processes, saving companies time and money to focus on more strategic initiatives. Microsoft Teams enable groups across departments and companies to collaborate better together and Microsoft Dynamics 365 helps your sales and marketing professionals track leads and close pipeline. When you combine the power and ease-of-use from Nintex automation platform with Microsoft Teams and Dynamics, you begin to simplify and drive higher output. Come learn more about how Nintex and Microsoft are integrated to enable any organization to be more effective and productive.

data.title: Automate your tasks with Project, Planner, and Microsoft Flow
data.sortTitle: automate your tasks with project, planner, and microsoft flow
data.description: Learn how to use Microsoft Flow to automate your Microsoft Project and Microsoft Planner tasks to customize workflow for your organization.

data.title: Automating build and runtime protection for Azure workloads and applications
data.sortTitle: automating build and runtime protection for azure workloads and applications
data.description: Containers have drastically changed our deployment model to become more dynamic in nature. Microsoft now defines Azure workloads as an arbitrary unit with each workload viewed as either an application or a micro-service. Containers, hosts, and our orchestration tools may contain different vulnerabilities open to exploitation. To assess security within our Azure workloads we must facilitate both runtime and pre-deployment security controls within a single security solution. We demonstrate how vulnerability shielding can be automated to make developers’ lives easy with end-to-end security that goes beyond detections. We include mitigating controls to block exploits, automate image scanning feedback, and adhere to best practices.

data.title: Avoid the pitfalls: See how to deploy your native and non-native Microsoft Teams devices correctly
data.sortTitle: avoid the pitfalls: see how to deploy your native and non-native microsoft teams devices correctly
data.description: See live demonstrations on how to configure and deploy native Teams endpoints like Teams IP Phones and Microsoft Teams Rooms. We also focus on best practices on the deployment of non-native solutions via Cloud Video Interop.

data.title: Azure Active Directory B2B versus multi-tenant apps: Notes from the field
data.sortTitle: azure active directory b2b versus multi-tenant apps: notes from the field
data.description: John Craddock has created this session as the result of a real-world scenario. A forms-auth app, running in Azure, was providing services to several enterprise customers. These enterprise customers were requesting that they should have SSO using their on-premises AD credentials. How can the solution be built? We have to start by selecting a federated authentication protocol for the app. Allowing partners and other organizations to access the application requires either the creation of an Azure AD multi-tenant app or providing access to the app via Azure AD B2B services. Come to this session and learn about the pros and cons of each solution. Don’t miss the demos showing the results.

data.title: Azure Active Directory cloud authentication doesn’t just mean “sign-in”
data.sortTitle: azure active directory cloud authentication doesn’t just mean “sign-in”
data.description: When you sign-in to the Azure AD, cloud fault tolerance, scalability, and enhanced security are inbuilt. Through the Azure AD management portal, it is simple to enable a plethora of technologies, enhancing both your organization’s security posture and user experience. Come to this session, where John Craddock shares his real-world experience and insight into reaping the rewards and benefits of Azure AD. Learn how to choose the best sign-in options for both your cloud and hybrid-users. Also, learn how to mitigate risk through the use of conditional access policies. Combine this with Windows Hello or FIDO, and you are building secure sign-in for the future. The session packed with demos and definitely should not be missed.

data.title: Azure Active Directory: New features and roadmap
data.sortTitle: azure active directory: new features and roadmap
data.description: For anyone working on or looking in to identity and access management in the cloud, come to this can't-miss session to get updates on Azure Active Directory and our vision and roadmap areas for identity in the next year. You'll hear about the newest features and experiences that provide seamless access for any identity, protect your organization from breaches, and use the latest open standards.

data.title: Azure and the command line – options, tips and tricks
data.sortTitle: azure and the command line – options, tips and tricks
data.description: If you love working from the command line, this session covers all the things you need to know to get the most out of the experience on Windows, Mac, and Linux. We start with Windows command line, then the new Terminal, and the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL). Then, we cover some interesting developments in the Azure Cloud Shell and show you how you can work with command line options in Visual Studio Code. By the end of this 15 minute session you'll have some new and interesting ways to control the cloud from your keyboard!
learningPath: Developer	Building applications for the cloud

data.title: Azure automation for managing servers across your environment
data.sortTitle: azure automation for managing servers across your environment
data.description: This session is focused on helping IT optimize and automate server management for cloud and on-premises. We discuss the transition to cloud based services, review how IT can empower the teams to manage their workloads while providing guidance and governance, and walk through best practices and customer learnings. Last, we share our roadmap for the next evolution of server management.

data.title: Azure Dedicated Host deep dive
data.sortTitle: azure dedicated host deep dive
data.description: With Azure Dedicated Host you can deploy your very own private cloud in Azure. Control the maintenance window, gain direct visibility over the underlying server infrastructure, and place your Azure VMs on a single tenant server to satisfy specific compliance or regulatory requirements without compromising your security posture. Join this session to explore and evaluate the use cases and workloads that can benefit from Azure Dedicated Host.

data.title: Azure encryption and key management for enterprise scale
data.sortTitle: azure encryption and key management for enterprise scale
data.description: Microsoft Azure is strongly committed to ensuring your data privacy, data sovereignty and enabling you to control your Azure hosted data through a range of advanced technologies to encrypt, control, and manage encryption keys, control, and audit access of data. This allows you to safeguard your data and to meet your organizational security and compliance commitments. To accommodate a range of requirements, Azure gives you flexibility to choose the solution that best meets your business needs. In this session, we cover best practices for how organizations can roll out and manage encryption controls in Azure at enterprise-wide scale, using examples from Azure customers.

data.title: Azure Machine Learning and open source: Designed for each other
data.sortTitle: azure machine learning and open source: designed for each other
data.description: Azure Machine Learning is committed to being the best place for open source machine learning. From LIME to ONNX, to Kubeflow and ML FLOW, Azure Machine Learning provides choice and flexibility throughout the machine learning lifecycle. With support for tens of thousands of open-source Python packages such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn, Azure Machine Learning gives you the flexibility and scale to globalize your machine learning workloads. This session goes deep into how to use open source technologies with the scale of Azure to globalize any machine learning project.

data.title: Azure Machine Learning on the edge: Deploying and running models on IoT devices
data.sortTitle: azure machine learning on the edge: deploying and running models on iot devices
data.description: The rate of innovation in hardware for the intelligent edge has led to challenges in building intelligent applications and services. Azure Machine Learning and Data Box Edge introduce FPGA acceleration at the edge to enable real-time inferencing with super low latency. This session shows you how to efficiently build and deploy machine learning for the vastly complex ecosystem of hybrid and disconnected architectures.

data.title: Azure Migrate: The next evolution
data.sortTitle: azure migrate: the next evolution
data.description: The latest release of Azure Migrate reinforces Microsoft’s commitment to bring simplicity to your migration journey across phases of discovery, assessment, and migration. In this session we demo all the highlights from the latest enhancements to Azure Migrate, including new migration capabilities and improvements that streamline the migration process such as guided experiences. We also take a look at new partner integrations that deliver customer choice from our comprehensive ecosystem of partner migration tools.

data.title: Azure migration journey: Best practices and open mic Q&A
data.sortTitle: azure migration journey: best practices and open mic q&a
data.description:
Migration is a big move and could be a complex process when you need to take VM, Data and Application into consideration.
Get an overview of the migration journey, learn how to plan and what are the best practices to apply to your migration journey. Meet the Product Engineering teams behind Azure Migrate, Database Migration Service and App Service Migration for and open mic session.

data.title: Azure Monitor fundamentals: What, why, and how
data.sortTitle: azure monitor fundamentals: what, why, and how
data.description: You have workloads running on Azure along with on-premises environments and need to have a holistic monitoring solution. You need to figure out the data sources, correlate the data, and analyze them – there’s a lot to do but where do you even start? If you are facing these questions, join us for an overview of monitoring in Azure. We show you how to onboard and take advantage of the different solutions in Azure Monitor to make sure your workloads are always up and running.

data.title: Azure Pipelines you can trust
data.sortTitle: azure pipelines you can trust
data.description: CI/CD has revolutionized code and even infrastructure deployments, allowing companies to reap the advantages of getting to production faster and more reliably. But the enterprise IT/operations side still must ensure that every deployment is safe and meets the enterprise policies! Finding the balance between providing autonomy to development teams and ensuring security and compliance standards can be tricky. In this session, learn how to leverage Azure Pipelines to make sure that every production deployment complies with the enterprise policy. We also cover implementing policy and config as code, and integrating with Azure Blueprints.

data.title: Azure SQL Database Edge: Overview
data.sortTitle: azure sql database edge: overview
data.description: Azure SQL Database Edge offers the same SQL database engine which is optimized to run at the edge with a small resource footprint and with built-in capabilities like streaming support. This session covers how Microsoft is enabling intelligence over data at the edge and creating an ability to "develop once, deploy anywhere" with its database offering at the edge. Learn about the common scenarios that customers are implementing with Azure SQL Database Edge and new features that the product offers for the intelligent edge.

data.title: Azure SQL Database managed instance disaster recovery architecture best practices
data.sortTitle: azure sql database managed instance disaster recovery architecture best practices
data.description: During this session, learn the best practices on how to implement a disaster recovery architecture for Azure SQL Database managed instance using failover groups. Azure SQL Database managed instance is a deployment option in Azure SQL Database that is highly compatible with SQL Server, providing out-of-the-box support for most SQL Server database features. Managed instance also provides native virtual network (VNET) support for an isolated, highly secure environment to run your applications. We show live demos on how the HADR architecture can be configured and how it works.

data.title: Azure SQL Database Managed Instance: A fully managed SQL Server in the cloud
data.sortTitle: azure sql database managed instance: a fully managed sql server in the cloud
data.description: Azure SQL Database Managed Instance offers the best combination of a fully managed cloud service and SQL Server compatibility. This makes it the recommended destination for migration of most SQL Server workloads to cloud. Over the last year, Azure SQL Database Managed Instance has been much enhanced in terms of functionality, the networking and security setup has been simplified, and new purchasing options have brought lower entry points and economy-at-scale offers. The time to migrate is now, so start exploiting the increased productivity and cost savings that the managed cloud gives you. Come and hear about the best practices of cloud migration, the latest enhancements of Azure SQL Database Managed Instance, and the future roadmap.

data.title: Azure SQL Database serverless: Providing autoscaling and optimized price-performance for your database workloads
data.sortTitle: azure sql database serverless: providing autoscaling and optimized price-performance for your database workloads
data.description: Azure SQL Database serverless is a new compute tier that optimizes price-performance and simplifies performance management for single databases with intermittent, unpredictable usage. Serverless automatically scales compute for databases based on workload demand and bills only for compute used per second. Serverless also automatically pauses databases during inactive periods when only storage is billed and automatically resumes when activity returns. Join us for this session to learn about using serverless in SQL Database and save cost while achieving the desired performance.

data.title: Azure SQL Database: Maximizing cloud performance and availability
data.sortTitle: azure sql database: maximizing cloud performance and availability
data.description: When you move to Azure SQL Database, you select a pre-defined set of allocated resources across several dimensions such as CPU, memory, storage, and more. For a typical business application you need to find a balance between cost, performance demands and availability requirements. Yet for your mission critical application your focus moves toward the highest availability (i.e. 99.995% uptime) and performance. In this session we review best practices around how to select your Azure SQL database configuration that is optimized for a specific application pattern and how to maximize its performance and availability. We review the natural advantages you can leverage from the Azure SQL Database ecosystem and detail factors to consider when optimizing for performance in the cloud, including application patterns and anti-patterns that you may encounter when migrating legacy applications from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database.

data.title: Azure SQL unified creation and management experience
data.sortTitle: azure sql unified creation and management experience
data.description:
With the new Azure SQL unified experience it is easier than ever to discover, create, and manage your SQL databases, instances, pools, and virtual machines all in one convenient location. The unified create experience offers an overview of our Azure SQL offerings and guidance on which resource is right for you based on your application’s requirements. The centralized management experience helps you quickly navigate to and manage any of your Azure SQL resources by searching and filtering on any available resource characteristic. From this unified experience you can also easily access the suite of manageability features offered for SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines.

Learn more about the Azure SQL platform and check out this new experience at https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2100641

data.title: Azure tips and tricks: Become more productive with Microsoft Azure
data.sortTitle: azure tips and tricks: become more productive with microsoft azure
data.description: Join this fast-paced, demo-heavy session, which takes you through some long-standing favorite Azure tips and tricks (http://azuredev.tips) since the series started. Whether you’re interested in learning quick ways to navigate the Azure Portal, making the most of the Azure CLI, or working with IDE and editors, there’s something for everyone. Spend the time now to shave hours off of your coding tasks tomorrow.

data.title: Azure updates: Learn how we update Microsoft Azure and how you can increase control for your environment
data.sortTitle: azure updates: learn how we update microsoft azure and how you can increase control for your environment
data.description: Our commitment in Azure is to keep the infrastructure that hosts your VMs secure, performing at its best, resilient, and up to date with new features. In this session we share the processes we follow to rollout changes safely to our fleet. We also share the features that provide you different levels of control to apply these updates, especially for sensitive applications.

data.title: Azure VMware Solutions overview and lessons learned from early adopters
data.sortTitle: azure vmware solutions overview and lessons learned from early adopters
data.description: Join us to for an overview of Azure VMware Solutions and gain insights into use cases and customer success stories. This session brings Azure VMware Solutions to life in the context of actual customer deployments, revealing challenges and best practices you can rely on today.

data.title: Azure VMware Solutions: How to run native VMware workloads in Azure
data.sortTitle: azure vmware solutions: how to run native vmware workloads in azure
data.description: Learn how customers can run their VMware Software Defined Data Center (ESXi, vCenter, NSX-T and vSAN) on native Azure baremetal hardware. This session provides an overview of key use cases, solution overview and customer benefits for the adoption of VMware in Azure.

data.title: Be a Windows Admin Center expert: Best practices for deployment, configuration, and security
data.sortTitle: be a windows admin center expert: best practices for deployment, configuration, and security
data.description: Learn about all the available options when deploying Windows Admin Center in your environment. Should you install on your Windows 10 laptop, or deploy a Windows Admin Center on a dedicated server for multi-user access, RBAC, or HA? If you deploy a gateway, join us to review the security and configuration best practices for the optimal experience.

data.title: Best practices and lessons learned from securely operating Microsoft Azure Stack
data.sortTitle: best practices and lessons learned from securely operating microsoft azure stack
data.description: Join us to learn what it takes to successfully integrate, operate, service, and secure Azure Stack in your datacenter.

data.title: Best practices and tips for operating and monitoring apps on Azure App Service
data.sortTitle: best practices and tips for operating and monitoring apps on azure app service
data.description: Now that you deployed your web app, come explore what you should be doing to monitor its health and performance and ensure uptime in the face of unexpected bugs, unanticipated demand spikes and random occurrences of Murphy's Law.

data.title: Best practices for compatibility assessment and Microsoft Office 365 ProPlus upgrades using Office Readiness in Configuration Manager
data.sortTitle: best practices for compatibility assessment and microsoft office 365 proplus upgrades using office readiness in configuration manager
data.description:
In this session, we cover the following topics: 
• Evaluating Office Readiness
• Using Readiness Toolkit for advanced VBA readiness
• Discovering and remediating issues
• Deploying to “ready devices” with the right settings
• Identifying optimal pilots to unblock more devices
• Viewing health on deployed devices
• Viewing unblocked devices
• Advanced plug-in reports (accessibility)

data.title: Best practices for deploying and managing Microsoft Office 365 ProPlus
data.sortTitle: best practices for deploying and managing microsoft office 365 proplus
data.description: Learn from what's new from the Office engineering team on how to best deploy and manage Office 365 ProPlus within your environment. In this session we walk through the tools and discuss the best options to suit your environment.

data.title: Best practices for optimizing performance of SharePoint sites and portals in Microsoft 365
data.sortTitle: best practices for optimizing performance of sharepoint sites and portals in microsoft 365
data.description: Learn how to improve and optimize the performance of SharePoint sites and portals, directly from the Microsoft SharePoint engineering team. Explore new ways to drive information architecture and navigation, and how to avoid common pitfalls that impact end user experience.

data.title: Best, better, Hyperscale: The last database you will ever need in the cloud
data.sortTitle: best, better, hyperscale: the last database you will ever need in the cloud
data.description: Do you struggle with large unwieldy databases and application sprawl? In this session discover what to use and when, patterns and best practices for moving to Azure with Hyperscale. We take a deep dive under the covers of Hyperscale, to show how Microsoft has achieved a truly cloud scale and cloud native database deployment. Come understand how Hyperscale can enable you to innovate with a future-proof, world class, fully managed database that offers all the SQL Server features that you know and love.

data.title: Big data processing with Spark and .NET
data.sortTitle: big data processing with spark and .net
data.description: Learn how to harness the best of Spark and .NET for your data processing pipelines with the newest support for Spark in .NET.

data.title: Bosch: Saving lives with the wrong-way driver warning system using Kubernetes and cloud-native tech
data.sortTitle: bosch: saving lives with the wrong-way driver warning system using kubernetes and cloud-native tech
data.description:
Bosch’s wrong-way driver warning system (WDW) watches over one million active users in 17 countries. By analyzing movement signals through HDInsight, Kafka Stream, and custom machine learning modules, WDW maps traffic data and is able to predict possible collisions, triggering alerts to nearby drivers when a driver is going the wrong way.

The system runs on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) processing a large amount of events and takes real-time intelligent decisions. This session is about the learnings, evaluations, and architecture changes that the Bosch team has made since the go-live 12 months ago.

data.title: Bottom up innovation with Microsoft Flow
data.sortTitle: bottom up innovation with microsoft flow
data.description: Today’s organizations are continuously searching for ways to become more efficient while remaining cost effective. With Microsoft Flow and the Power Platform organizations can democratize innovation and enable the people closest to the problem to have the tools to fix the problems! In this session, learn about the obstacles to adopting democratized technologies, how to overcome them, and how to become an organization with bottom up innovation advocates from IT professionals to end users.

data.title: Bring the performance of your Azure applications to the next level
data.sortTitle: bring the performance of your azure applications to the next level
data.description: The combination of proximity placement groups, generation 2 Azure VMs, Azure Ultra Disks, pre-provisioning services and ephemeral OS disks can bring the performance of your applications to the next level. Choosing the right Azure VM and taking advantage of Azure Advisor recommendations gives you additional ways to get the most out of Azure IaaS for your workloads. This engaging session demonstrates practical ways to significantly improve the performance of your Azure applications.

data.title: Bring your channels together using the Channel Integration Framework V2
data.sortTitle: bring your channels together using the channel integration framework v2
data.description: See how you can enable your agents to interact with customers on multiple channels simultaneously.  In this session you will learn how you can leverage the Channel Integration Framework V2 to bring your existing channel providers into a singular modern interface, Dynamics 365 Omnichannel for Customer Service.

data.title: Bringing file services into the 2020s: Migrate SMB and NFS file shares to the cloud with Azure Files and Sync
data.sortTitle: bringing file services into the 2020s: migrate smb and nfs file shares to the cloud with azure files and sync
data.description:
Are you wondering where you're going to move your SMB file shares when Windows Server 2008 R2 goes end-of-life in January 2020? What about those NFS shares on that aging NAS device that back your organization’s critical line-of-business applications? And what about this cloud thing everyone is talking about? Nobody wants a cloud migration strategy that looks like running and managing a bunch of file server VMs in the cloud and other cloud vendors have totally different services for SMB and NFS. With Azure Files, you get simple, secure, and serverless file shares that you can mount directly with SMB, cache locally on premises with Azure File Sync, and at Microsoft Ignite 2019, we are extremely excited to add NFS 4.1 (preview) support as well. Azure Files makes cloud migrations a breeze by providing consistent administrator experience for all of your cloud file shares!

This session provides a deep-dive on how you can use the new features of Azure Files to migrate general purpose file shares, lift and shift existing line-of-business applications, and build modern container-based applications. In addition to covering NFS 4.1, we discuss our new lower-cost file share tiers, how you can domain join an Azure file share to your on-premises AD domain, previous versions integration for Azure File Sync, and more!

data.title: Bringing IT and security together: How Microsoft is reinventing threat and vulnerability management
data.sortTitle: bringing it and security together: how microsoft is reinventing threat and vulnerability management
data.description: Through 2020, known vulnerabilities will play a role in more than 99.9% of attacks. Reducing the exposure to known vulnerabilities and misconfiguration, or stopping the threat before it happens, is the first and best defense against these attacks. Equally important is bringing together security and IT teams to empower them to be able to quickly and seamlessly remediate vulnerabilities. In this session, we will talk about Microsoft’s disruptive risk-driven threat & vulnerability management based on Microsoft Defender ATP signals. By leveraging our worldwide visibility of third party applications installed/running, embedded sensors, threat-intelligence, and endpoint protection technologies we will enable security teams to discover, prioritize and remediate known vulnerabilities and misconfiguration exploited by threat actors.

data.title: Build a highly secure and scalable mobile backend using App Center
data.sortTitle: build a highly secure and scalable mobile backend using app center
data.description: As a developer building mobile application for millions of users, setting up a scalable and secure backend is critical for your app’s success. Join us in this session as we share how to authenticate and authorize your users, build serverless APIs in the cloud, store and sync application data across multiple devices, cater for both online and offline scenarios and get real-time updates, and send push notifications based on users’ behavior in the app. In this demo-packed session, learn how easy it is to build a high-class, secure, and reliable mobile app using App Center’s backend services to deliver a rich user experience and scale to millions of users.

data.title: Build a more engaged and data-driven customer and employee culture with Forms
data.sortTitle: build a more engaged and data-driven customer and employee culture with forms
data.description: Come learn about Forms and Forms Pro and see how to integrate survey data with customer data to drive deeper customer engagement with this new survey tool. Microsoft Forms is a simple, lightweight app that lets you easily create surveys, quizzes, and polls.

data.title: Build and deploy your ASP.NET Core application with DevOps in 20 minutes or less
data.sortTitle: build and deploy your asp.net core application with devops in 20 minutes or less
data.description: Getting started with an ASP.NET Core application is just the beginning of your application development journey. Does it compile? How will you run tests and ensure the application is in a working state? What does your deployment story look like? In this fast-paced session, we show you how easy it is to get started with Azure DevOps as the premier solution for continuous integration and continuous deployment for ASP.NET Core.

data.title: Build better form recognizer models with a human feedback loop
data.sortTitle: build better form recognizer models with a human feedback loop
data.description: Come learn how to use Form Recognizer's feedback loop capabilities to retrain and improve the quality of your form recognition AI models.

data.title: Build great Microsoft 365 experiences on the web and beyond
data.sortTitle: build great microsoft 365 experiences on the web and beyond
data.description: In this session, learn how Microsoft is enabling you to build great accessible, themable, and customizable user experiences that fits seamlessly into the Microsoft 365 application ecosystem. We show you how you can use the Microsoft Fluent Design System to create experiences that blend with your own brand. In this session we introduce you to the UX Framework we can all use to build Microsoft 365 experiences either on the web, mobile, or desktop.

data.title: Build high performance time series and log data analysis solutions with Azure Data Explorer
data.sortTitle: build high performance time series and log data analysis solutions with azure data explorer
data.description: Azure Data Explorer is an interactive analytics service for fast flowing data. Come and learn how you can build a high performant on-demand real-time analytics solutions, query billion of records in seconds, and use built-in advanced time series and machine learning capabilities.

data.title: Build Python apps in Azure faster with Visual Studio Code
data.sortTitle: build python apps in azure faster with visual studio code
data.description: In 45 short minutes, we walk you through how to use Visual Studio Code and Microsoft Azure to supercharge your Python development and build powerful applications in the cloud. We cover web applications, serverless data processing, and machine learning inferencing APIs. Along the way, we use Azure App Service, Azure Functions, the newly revamped Python SDKs and the Azure VS Code extensions. You'll walk away with a better understanding of how it all ties together and sample code you can continue to build off of.

data.title: Build rich visual solutions using Visio APIs to solve real-world problems visually
data.sortTitle: build rich visual solutions using visio apis to solve real-world problems visually
data.description: Microsoft Visio is a great platform for building rich visual solutions that solve challenging real-world problems. With new Visio APIs for the web you can now build customized dashboards and SharePoint mashups.

data.title: Build your adoption success hub
data.sortTitle: build your adoption success hub
data.description: Come to this workshop and learn how to build your end user success hub with Microsoft Teams. Discover how to use our end user training template, adoption planning tools and our Champions in a Box kit to supercharge your adoption program for success.

data.title: Building & Managing distributed micro-perimeters with Azure Firewall
data.sortTitle: building & managing distributed micro-perimeters with azure firewall
data.description: Using a Zero Trust approach is key to architecting security that spans on-premises and cloud.  Identity plays a key role however network security remains very important in the way you implement it .  Come and learn how to micro-segment to create micro-perimeters that deliver network isolation using Azure Firewall and other networking services that were announced earlier at Ignite.  In addition, you will learn about how Azure Firewall integrates with 3rd party solutions to provide a centralized management experience.

data.title: Building a golden image pipeline
data.sortTitle: building a golden image pipeline
data.description: A golden image provides the template which a virtual machine is created from. It may be referred to as a base image or an image template. As infrastructure-as-code enables velocity through automation, tools such as HashiCorp's Packer have become standard for creating golden images from code. Coupled with build tools such as Azure DevOps, Hashicorp’s Packer and Terraform, we can create pipelines to host golden images in Azure, and make them available through Azures Shared Image Gallery. Join this session to see how CDW uses golden images to allow you to do the configuration work once, and use it across your entire infrastructure. It will save you time, make you faster and reduce human error.

data.title: Building a path to digital privacy with decentralized identities
data.sortTitle: building a path to digital privacy with decentralized identities
data.description: Organizations that support Decentralized Identity want to provide privacy respecting tools and services for users to own and control their Identity. Come learn why we need Decentralized Identity, see a proof of concept to compare and contrast with existing account-based systems, and share known challenges ahead for delivering a decentralized identity experience for everyone and everything.

data.title: Building a PowerShell module with Azure Automation
data.sortTitle: building a powershell module with azure automation
data.description:
Building an API-first software platform provides unlimited opportunities for third-party integrations. Except that understanding developer documentation for API integration can be daunting for infrastructure engineers who may have only recently created their first Hello, World application! An exceptional PowerShell module transcends experience, and is easily usable whether consumed by a first-time coder or an experienced user. 

This session discusses the challenges faced and lessons learned when building and maintaining a PowerShell module with Azure Automation.

data.title: Building a real-time personalization engine using Azure Cosmos DB and new built-in Spark capabilities
data.sortTitle: building a real-time personalization engine using azure cosmos db and new built-in spark capabilities
data.description: Think fast! Many of today’s most engaging applications provide real-time, personalized experiences to users. In this demo-filled session, we show you how you can use Azure Cosmos DB and it’s new built-in Spark capabilities to build machine learning models, mine your data, and serve fast, targeted recommendations at scale. We show how to build the data ingestion pipeline to handle high volumes of streaming data, build a machine learning model, and serve the recommendations to your users with <10ms latency.

data.title: Building a Smart Chatbot with the Microsoft Graph Security API
data.sortTitle: building a smart chatbot with the microsoft graph security api
data.description: Join this session to learn how Lumagate, a Microsoft partner, built SIMON, a language-enabled chatbot for Microsoft Teams, and integrated it with Microsoft’s intelligent cybersecurity platform using the Microsoft Graph Security API. You’ll learn about the application, tips and tricks on how they built it, and lessons learned along with the way that may ease your journey. Finally, see a demo of their solution in action!

data.title: Building enterprise capable serverless applications
data.sortTitle: building enterprise capable serverless applications
data.description: Industry and customer needs push enterprises to innovate and modernize their applications at a faster rate than ever before. Serverless solutions are a clear and natural choice for such demand due its proven developer productivity gains. However enterprises also require using services that can respond to their critical needs around: networking, security, performance, DevOps, ability to run on-premises and compatibility with industry standards (e.g. Kubernetes). In this session we explore how serverless development with the Azure platform helps satisfy all these requirements. We go over details of enterprise scenarios, such as resource automation, highlighting premium capabilities in Azure Functions and other Azure services.

data.title: Building enterprise ready, scalable AI solutions using Azure Cognitive Services
data.sortTitle: building enterprise ready, scalable ai solutions using azure cognitive services
data.description: Leading enterprises are using AI to power innovation across industries, including healthcare, automotive, and finance. In this session, gain insight into how these enterprise AI solutions are implemented using Azure Cognitive Services. In this session, we demonstrate how customers like Crayon, SAP, and Kroger are building scalable AI solutions using Cognitive Services containers.

data.title: Building event driven apps with Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions
data.sortTitle: building event driven apps with azure cosmos db and azure functions
data.description: Users expect modern apps to offer event-driven, real-time experiences. In this demo-packed session, learn how to build event-driven apps using Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions. Learn how to subscribe to changes in Azure Cosmos DB collections and trigger logic in real time without needing to manage any servers. Understand real-world use cases in multi-billion dollar industries, ranging from retail, IoT, gaming, and more.

data.title: Building great push notifications for your Microsoft 365 users
data.sortTitle: building great push notifications for your microsoft 365 users
data.description: Notifications continue to be one of the top drivers of app engagement in today’s multi-device world and help you reach your users in real-time.  A great notification experience targets the user on any device or platform (Windows, Android, iOS, and web).  Join us to learn how you can easily and cost-effectively drive higher user engagement and increase productivity within your apps using our enterprise-compliant, user-centric, cross-device notification platform.

data.title: Building high-value integrated data center solutions for Microsoft Azure Stack
data.sortTitle: building high-value integrated data center solutions for microsoft azure stack
data.description: Join us to learn about designing an Azure Stack solution with large scale storage, modernizing your datacenter with new application infrastructure, planning for production readiness with data protection and disaster recovery, and providing the best environment for developers building hybrid solutions.

data.title: Building industrial autonomous systems with reinforcement learning
data.sortTitle: building industrial autonomous systems with reinforcement learning
data.description:
The recent use of advanced AI to “solve” vintage Atari video games, classic boardgames of Go and backgammon, and modern team-based games of Dota and Starcraft has put reinforcement learning (RL) into the spotlight. At its core, RL is about learning behavior in complex, dynamic environments. Beyond the realm of gaming, Microsoft is extending RL with machine teaching, in order to make the RL accessible to subject matter experts, and to champion an approach for RL in the real-world.

The autonomous systems team at Microsoft is opening a public preview for developers to start playing with and learning more about reinforcement learning and machine teaching. 
Learn about the autonomous systems platform with real-world case studies showing the techniques used to improve the performance of high value applications in the areas of electronics manufacturing, chemical process control, upstream oil and gas, and building automation systems. Join us for a hands-on tour of the platform, with practical coding demos and examples.

data.title: Building ISV solutions on the on the Microsoft Power Platform
data.sortTitle: building isv solutions on the on the microsoft power platform
data.description: Through the lens of an ISV/software developer, we walk you through the entire application development process showcasing what it takes to build a new, composite app from the ground up using out-of-the-box no-code/no-code tooling, to extending with custom code and publishing to AppSource allowing you to reach 120M+ monthly active users. We also provide you a preview of new key capabilities we are delivering, specifically to empower the ISV ecosystem.

data.title: Building modern apps that scale to billions of events with Azure Database for PostgreSQL and Hyperscale (Citus)
data.sortTitle: building modern apps that scale to billions of events with azure database for postgresql and hyperscale (citus)
data.description: Come learn why customers call Hyperscale (Citus) a game changer (their words, not ours.) With the launch of Hyperscale (Citus), you can now scale out real-time analytics workloads horizontally using Azure Database for PostgreSQL. This session explores why so many developers are adopting the open source Postgres database, and highlights what makes our managed Postgres service on Azure unique. Then, we dive into real-world use cases to show how you can build scalable real-time analytics apps using Azure, Postgres, and Hyperscale (Citus). In particular, we show how one team built a petabyte-scale analytics dashboard that supports real-time decision making with response times of 90 ms—even with 6M queries/day across billions of rows.

data.title: Building open standards based autonomous drones with Dronecode and AirSim
data.sortTitle: building open standards based autonomous drones with dronecode and airsim
data.description:
According to Gartner, hundreds of thousands of drones are sold each year for use in commercial and industrial scenarios. One common drone scenario is for remote inspection. In inspection scenarios, drones are typically flown manually around the site or object to be inspected gathering video and images for human review at a later date.  Drones are increasingly moving from manual operations to more autonomous operations and missions. Microsoft’s autonomous systems platform enables you to build increased autonomy into your drone solutions. Using Dronecode and the autonomous systems platform, learn how to architect an autonomous inspection drone. Microsoft joined the Dronecode project, which promotes an end-to-end open source stack for building autonomous drones. The Dronecode platform includes PX4 for flight control, QGroundControl for ground control, AirSim for simulation, and the Robot Operating System (ROS) for programming.

In this talk, we introduce you to the architecture for building your own autonomous drones using Dronecode and the autonomous systems platform. Learn about the end-to-end stack and how to develop using simulation and then move to actual hardware for testing.

data.title: Building out scale applications with Azure Virtual Machines Scale Sets
data.sortTitle: building out scale applications with azure virtual machines scale sets
data.description: Learn how to architect and deploy applications using Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets (VMSS). Increase control, define policies, scale your Azure infrastructure resources to match your business and IT requirements. Develop robust and dynamic applications. Tap into the breadth of the Microsoft Azure portfolio to deploy your apps at scale with Shared Image Gallery using VMSS capabilities like automatic OS image upgrades and autoscaling.

data.title: Building PWAs to reach users on Windows and beyond
data.sortTitle: building pwas to reach users on windows and beyond
data.description: Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) allow you to deliver an app-like experience to your users across most mobile and desktop operating systems. PWAs are built on web standards, work offline, and provide a modern app experience often indistinguishable from traditional native applications. In this technical session, learn what Microsoft is doing to help developers and companies adopt standards-based PWAs, and how you can get started today. Also, learn how to take your PWA to the next level with desktop-specific APIs, Microsoft Graph, and seamless authentication with Azure Active Directory (AAD) and consumer authentications. If you are considering a PWA for your next project, or curious about how PWAs can work within your app strategy, join us for this session.

data.title: Building resilient applications in Azure
data.sortTitle: building resilient applications in azure
data.description: In this session, learn how to easily build applications in Azure that are inherently resilient. Use Azure Virtual Machine Scale Set (VMSS), Availability Sets, Availability Zones, highly available images with Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) accounts in regions that support Availability Zones with Shared Image Gallery. Take advantage of the SLA continuum that Azure offers, scheduled events, event grid, and more.

data.title: Building serverless web applications in Azure
data.sortTitle: building serverless web applications in azure
data.description: Learn how to build web apps without managing web servers in Azure. Run interactive web client code in the browser with JavaScript or Blazor front-ends and extend with powerful serverless API back-ends. Go from repo to cloud quickly with low cost, high performance, and dynamic scale. Bring microservices design patterns to your web solutions with modular and extensible serverless architecture.

data.title: Building the future of sales with Microsoft Dynamics 365
data.sortTitle: building the future of sales with microsoft dynamics 365
data.description: Interested in helping sales organizations go beyond sales force automation and embrace the modern buyer’s journey? Join this session to learn about the latest improvements to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, and new offerings with Dynamics 365 Sales Insights and see how we’re innovating to help sellers meet the demands of the modern customer. Get insight into the latest AI and relationship selling capabilities, guidance on positioning, and Microsoft’s vision for sales transformation.

data.title: Building your own deployer machine
data.sortTitle: building your own deployer machine
data.description: Martin Woodward explains how to build Das Deployer, a cool Raspberry Pi-powered device for approving releases in a fun way that will encourage your team to move to full automated deployments. He explains how to talk with Azure Pipelines using the APIs and how to build your own fun IoT devices to bring your DevOps processes to life in the office.
